intro: Alysicarpus scariosus var. pilifer, commonly known as the hairy burr sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, spiny fruits that aid in seed dispersal. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with alternate, ovate leaves that have a rough texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Due to its unique morphology and adaptability, it is often found in agricultural areas and along roadsides.
